title: How to Make Homemade Hot Chocolate

steps.title: Make the cocoa mixture.
steps.content: Make the cocoa mixture. Combine 1 tbsp. of cocoa powder and 1 tbsp. of granulated sugar in a bowl. Stir the ingredients a bit to combine them.

steps.title: Pour ¾ cups of water into another bowl or cup.
steps.content: Pour ¾ cups of water into another bowl or cup. Make sure it's microwave-safe.

steps.title: Microwave the water on high for 1 ½ minutes or until the water boils.
steps.content: Microwave the water on high for 1 ½ minutes or until the water boils.

steps.title: Pour the hot water over the cocoa mixture.
steps.content: Pour the hot water over the cocoa mixture. Stir the mixture until it’s smooth.

steps.title: Pour 2/3 cup skim evaporated milk into another cup.
steps.content: Pour 2/3 cup skim evaporated milk into another cup. Microwave it on high for 1 minute. Then, pour the warm milk into the mug with the water and cocoa mixture.

steps.title: Add ¾ tsp.
steps.content: Add ¾ tsp. of vanilla flavoring. Stir well to combine the ingredients. Then, place a few mini marshmallows in the cup.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy the taste of this cup of delicious hot chocolate with mini marshmallows -- if you'd like to treat a friend, just double the ingredients when you start making your hot chocolate, or repeat the process.

steps.title: Combine the first four ingredients together in a heavy saucepan.
steps.content: Combine the first four ingredients together in a heavy saucepan. Combine 1 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 cup of sugar, ¼ cup of instant espresso powder, 1 tbsp. vanilla, 1 pinch of salt, and 1 cup of cold water in a heavy saucepan and heat the mixture over low heat.

steps.title: Whisk the ingredients.
steps.content: Whisk the ingredients. Continue to whisk them until the cocoa powder is dissolved and the mixture is smooth and creamy.

steps.title: Gradually add the milk and half and half to the mixture.
steps.content: Gradually add the milk and half and half to the mixture. Add 6 cups of scalded milk and 2 cups of scalded half and half to the mixture over low heat, whisking the ingredients together until they’re hot but not boiling. Add 1 cup of milk and ¼ cup of half and half at a time and continue to add the rest of the milk and half and half in small portions until all of the ingredients are thoroughly blended.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy this tasty mocha hot chocolate as a breakfast treat or during any time of day.

steps.title: Heat 2 ½ cups of milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
steps.content: Heat 2 ½ cups of milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Heat it until the milk is hot, but not boiling. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add 4 oz.
steps.content: Add 4 oz. of chopped unsweetened chocolate and ½ cup of sugar to the milk. Stir the ingredients together until they’re blended.

steps.title: Add ¾ tsp.
steps.content: Add ¾ tsp. of cinnamon, ¼ tsp. of chili powder, and 1 seeded and sliced red bell pepper to the mixture. Bring the ingredients to a simmer.

steps.title: Remove the red pepper strips.
steps.content: Remove the red pepper strips. Their flavor will remain in the hot chocolate.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy this spicy hot chocolate at any time.

steps.title: Whisk together the milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and nutmeg in a large pot over medium heat.
steps.content: Whisk together the milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and nutmeg in a large pot over medium heat. Whisk together 6 (12 oz.) cans of evaporated milk, 4 tsp. of ground cinnamon, 1 tbsp. of vanilla extract, and 1 tsp. of ground nutmeg together in a large pot over medium heat. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add chocolate chips to the mixture.
steps.content: Add chocolate chips to the mixture. Add 2 (12 oz.) bags of semisweet chocolate chips to the mixture. Stir the hot chocolate until the chocolate is melted.

steps.title: Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes. This will blend the ingredients even more. Then remove the hot cocoa from the stove.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Sprinkle this hot chocolate with a pinch of cocoa powder and a pinch of cayenne pepper and enjoy it any time.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.

steps.title: Get a frying pan, milk and chocolate chips.
steps.content: Get a frying pan, milk and chocolate chips. Put the stove on medium low.

steps.title: Pour the milk and chocolate chips in.
steps.content: Pour the milk and chocolate chips in.

steps.title: Mix it for one to two minutes.
steps.content: Mix it for one to two minutes.

steps.title: Pour it in a cup, either by just pouring it in or with a big spoon.
steps.content: Pour it in a cup, either by just pouring it in or with a big spoon.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Add anything, from marshmallows to candy.
